General.Description: The youngest member, Dogecoin, was developed in 2013 as a progression into a fun meme on the Internet but has since become a serious payment system for online transactions. Dogecoin is a decentralized, peer-to-peer currency allowing you to easily deposit money online. Think of it as

The name comes from 'Doge', an Internet meme that combines the image of a Shiba Inu dog with English fragments on it. This meme has been popular on the web hosting top content since 2013. Dogecoin offers quite a lot of features much better than its era. Transfer time is just under 1 minute compared to 2.5 minutes of Litecoin and 10 minutes with BTC. Also, there is no limit on the production of Dogecoin, and it depends entirely on the supplies created by the developers.
General.Features: Some features of Dogecoin are Superfast transactions, no network congestion and transaction costs of a dogecoin (about 0.01 USD!). This coin is widely accepted on exchanges as well as a great tool to move between other currencies and FAST while keeping fees virtually non-existent.
General.Technology: Dogecoin is one of the digital currency launched after the success of Bitcoin. Dogecoin is widely available based on the Bitcoin protocol and Blockchain technology, but with modifications. It uses the technology script as a proof of work scheme. It has a blocking time of 60 seconds (1 minute) and a difficult retarget time of 4 hours. There is no limit to the number of Dogecoins that can be produced, meaning that the supply of coins is not used.
